chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine
Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd Larry Bellamy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Comply with any conditions imposed by Agent.

records.addlTxt: 11:17  Defendant Todd Larry Bellamy in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended information misdemeanor possession of drug paraph  is filed by Froelich.    Froelich -  Plead to the one count. S/W  Probation 1 yr  conditions as set by agent.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  DEF PLEADS GUILTY  Facts are correct   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS   The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of the charge in the amended information.  Court orders 30 days jail Sentence is Imposed and stayed. Court orders  Probation for 1 year. Conditions to comply with any conditions set by probation.  Court Costs  DNA Surcharge and sample.  1 day jail credit
Status conference on August 8, 2016 at 10:45 am.
from Atty Chapman to reschedule PTC, scheduled in another county.

Status conference on July 25, 2016 at 10:15 am.

Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to defendant.   Defendant has a copy of the information and waives reading of the information. Defendant enters not guilty plea at preliminary hearing for all counts.  Not guilty plea received by the court. Bond to continue. Set for pretrial conference on 6/6/16 at 2:30 p.m. 12:10

11:43 Heard at the same time is Case No 16CF60, Defendant Todd Larry Bellamy.Todd Larry Bellamy appeared in court with Atty Daniel Chapman. Defendant Scott G. Starfield in court with attorney Heidi J. Mangelsen.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Christopher Stewart is sworn and exam by Atty Froelich. Officer Stewart ID's defendant Scott G Starfield. Xexam by Atty Mangelsen. Investigator Jesse Neeley is sworn and exam by Atty Froelich. Investigator Neeley ID's defendant Todd Larry Bellamy. Xexam by Atty Chapman.   The court finds probable cause and binds both defendants over for further proceedings.
Pre-trial conference on June 6, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 28, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 3:34 Defendant Todd Larry Bellamy in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Chris Bub appeared in court.  Defendant has copy of complaint. Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Froelich: $3000 signature bond. Bub has no objection. Court goes over bond conditions with Def. Def has not been in the armed services.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 11:30 am.
